TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
> 
> The things I go through for you, dear readers!

Presumptuous of me to speak for anyone other than myself, but...

We love you for it, Kuzzter!

Happy landings!

> 
> Presumptuous of me to speak for anyone other than myself, but...
> We love you for it, Kuzzter!
> 
> 
> 
> Happy landings!

Indeed! I'm regularly checking this thread just to see if there is a new chapter posted several times a day (Or for what people are saying about the most recent chapters). Kuzzter, you are doing an absolutely great ob with this series, and these past few chapters have just been fantastic! Keep up the amazing work (And maybe I should rep some other people now so I can actually give you rep again)!

Thanks guys ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Sorry to keep you waiting so long today!

![N6gEL5h.png](http://i.imgur.com/N6gEL5h.png)

![p4GufdQ.png](http://i.imgur.com/p4GufdQ.png)

We'll have an Interlude of some sort (possibly featuring some business in and around Kerbin, dunno) and pick up Chapter 6 when the rescue flotilla gets to Eve SOI.
I love how the scansat is now permanently set to french ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

When this started, I would never have acknowledged the scope and depth of emotional response that could be evoked by a graphic novel.

I've said it before, and I'll say it again, you, sir, are an artist.

Thank you, once again.

Happy landings!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-19T01:37:19Z" title="09/19/2015 01:37  AM" data-short="8 yr">September 19, 2015</time> by Starhawk**

That, ladies and gentlemen...is how the true friendship looks like ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) That last page is full of awesome - good way to end the chapter (without evil cliffhanger lol).

> 
> I love how the scansat is now permanently set to french ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I've decided that only an Engineer can change the settings. I might set a probe for Polish or Portuguese one of these days, to name a couple other languages I know my friends speak--though I will mess that up even more than i mess up French! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> When this started, I would never have acknowledged the scope and depth of emotional response that could evoked by a graphic novel.

Thanks! I had the same feeling when reading [Order of the Stick](http://www.giantitp.com/comics/oots0001.html), which started out as a crudely drawn collection of in-jokes about a game, and evolved into a LOT more. Won't give you spoilers but there are a lot of scenes there which are guaranteed to jerk a tear--and these are bloody stick figures! Now that, friends, is *writing!* 

> 
> That, ladies and gentlemen...is how the true friendship looks like ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) That last page is full of awesome - good way to end the chapter (without evil cliffhanger lol).

Thanks Scotius! I am really enjoying exploring this friendship and glad you are too. Already thinking ahead to that moment when they meet again! But don't worry, there will be two or three "pulling the wings off a fly" (to quote Mr. G) style cliffhangers before then ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

So as you play, do you just take an incredible amount of screenshots in anticipation of making pages for this webcomic? I want to see your screenshots folder!

> 
> So as you play, do you just take an incredible amount of screenshots in anticipation of making pages for this webcomic? I want to see your screenshots folder!

I do take a bunch, yes. Typically when I am about to play through a segment of a mission that will be in the comic I have a general idea of how I'm going to present it on the page, so I take the shots I think I'll need from various angles as I go. I'll often take the same shot with and without F2 so that I can paste the character portraits somewhere alongside the 'uncluttered' image. More than once I've had to re-play a scene because I didn't get the right shot the first time. For scenese such as Dilsby's mohole nightmare and the Kerbahashi Maru scenario, I have a separate save where I hyperedit and mess with the persistence file to get the kerbals and ships where I need them to be.

Teaser while I work on the next bit:

![nJwsQlH.png](http://i.imgur.com/nJwsQlH.png)
